legalTeam.name: IRENE AKOTH OTTO
description: An Advocate of the High Court of Kenya with over 5 years' qualification experience.
She has a keen interest in the development of law and has demonstrable excellence in her work.
She employs a true global approach and is the head of the legal department at Ajani Centre.

legalTeam.name: NAIMA RAJAB
description: An Advocate of the High Court of Kenya with over 6 years' experience in the Human Rights space.
Naima is also a mediator at Nimraj consultancy.
She is passionate about legal empowerment and helps Kenyans use and shape the law through civic engagement and public participation.

legalTeam.name: STACY MURUGI
description: An Advocate of the High Court of Kenya with over 5 years' experience in litigation and non-contentious practice.
She is a certified professional mediator and is very passionate about human rights, especially those of women and children.
She is also the Human Resource Manager at Ajani.

legalTeam.name: PURITY WADEGU
description: An Advocate of the High Court of Kenya with a Bachelor's degree of Law from Kenyatta University and a postgraduate diploma from the Kenya School of Law.
Purity has extensive knowledge and experience in litigation, human rights law, and activism.
She is also the Executive Director at Ajani.

psychosocialTeam.name: OUMA SOROPHINA AKINYI
description: A holder of a Bachelor's degreee in Counselling Psychology
Sorophina is a licensed counselor under the Kenya Counselling Psychologist Association(KCPA).
She currently volunteers and work with children by offering art and play therapywhile also offering tutoring services for them.
She is also the Head of the Counselling Department at Ajani Centre for Rights and Care.

psychosocialTeam.name: GLORIA KINYA MICHENI
description: A counselling psychologist with a Bachelor's degree from the Catholic Univrsity of Eastern Africa
crrently pursuing her Masters in Management Organizational Deavelopment at the United States International University.
She is passionate about loss and grief counselling, drug and substance abuse counselling, psycho education and mentorship.

psychosocialTeam.name: ESTHER WANGU NGATIA
description: She is a counselling psychologist with a passion for supporting SGBV survivors.
She also plays a role i the communications department, leveraging expertise to raise awareness, advocate for change and empower the community.
She coes armed with empathy and communication skills to foster healing, resilence and understanding.

TeamPlayers.name: ZENA ABDULRAHMAN MUSA
description: Zena is a skilled program officer with over 4 years experience in project management, community mobilization and advocacy
leadreship, training and capacity building, community outreach and paralegal work.
She is the Program officer at Ajani Centre.

TeamPlayers.name: STEPHANIE ATIENO
description: Stephanie holds a Diploma in mass communication attained from the Kenya Institute of Mass Communication.
She brings her wealth of experience in writing and research to the communications department and Ajani.

TeamPlayers.name: MAKKA YUSUF
description: She is a paralegal who works closely with the team in th legal department.
She has several years of experience as a sexual and gender based community paralegal.

TeamPlayers.name: POLINE OTOO
description: Poline is an accountant by profession and is the chief financial officer at Ajani Centre.
